1555063961_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
The only actively developed DC clients are [DC++](http://dcplusplus.sourceforge.net/), [ApexDC++](https://www.apexdc.net/), [AirDC++](https://www.airdcpp.net/) and [EiskaltDC++](https://sourceforge.net/projects/eiskaltdcpp/).

Do not listen to @quantumworld nonsense below. DC++ clients are mature, although there are some vulnerabilities, mostly DoS, which got quickly patched. More information is available in DC/DC++ developers blog: https://dcpp.wordpress.com/

> [quantumworld](#comment_15_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): Stick dc++ in a tor or some program that will mask your ip. Then I will like DC++. Until then the copyright police can play there game of carrot. Its a game they play with newbies.

DC++ uses direct connections, without proxying/tunneling connections of other users. This is not a security problem or a vulnerability, this is per design, just as BitTorrent, ed2k or even ZeroNet. You may use proxy, VPN or any other method to cloak your IP address if you wish.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_74_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): it seems ApexDC (DC software) is unable to give me a magnet link of a directory, only a of a file. I wanted to link someone to a directory of many files so he can download whole directory easily

That's not possible to give magnet to directory since directories do not have TTH hashes. It's possible to give magnets for all individual files though.

1551906400_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
aMule is really buggy, networking code there is a trash. I recommend you to use eMule community edition or any other Windows fork using Wine.

TVU tracker also work: https://tvunderground.org.ru/

1570046222_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk, OpenVZ is not a virtualization, it's a container. LXC/LXD is pretty OK too, but it's probably not designed to be used as a 'container hosting' as OpenVZ is usually used.
I use LXD to run some of my projects, and pretty happy with it.

1568628122_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
Say, you have routable (non-NAT) IP address with port forwarding.
You're connected to the VPN on your PC, with default route via VPN.
Every incoming internet packet, that comes from the router, will be answered over VPN, with VPN IP address, and it won't work that way.

https://medium.com/@ValdikSS/another-critical-vpn-vulnerability-and-why-port-fail-is-bullshit-352b2ebd22e2

1566288245_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: Why not to build small NAS with several disks then? You can use 6x8TB HDDs on most motherboards.

> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_97_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): spending money on NAS (which is a computer with storage space) [...]

https://www.reddit.com/r/DataHoarder/wiki/index
Note that SnapRAID is also supported on Windows. It also has meging functionality but I not sure how good is it, I use mergerfs on linux.

1566209440_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: Do you want to automatically download everything, to help seeding? There's such functionality in [Tribler](https://www.tribler.org/) torrent client.

1552755084_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
I recommend you using [Mergerfs](https://github.com/trapexit/mergerfs) + [Snapraid](https://www.snapraid.it/) combination on Linux.
Mergerfs merges multiple HDDs into one big virtual one, with write balancing, and snapraid is a special "offline RAID" utility very suitable for NAS applications.
